snippet: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly met with some Muslim leaders on Tuesday, but others criticized his choice of whom to meet.
abstract: New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly meets behind closed doors with several Muslim leaders at Police Headquarters in an effort to respond to tumult over his department's controversial counterterrorism efforts; Muslim community leaders lace into what they see as a ploy to sidestep controversy by selecting participants and meeting privately.
lead_paragraph: Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly met with some Muslim leaders on Tuesday, but others criticized his choice of whom to meet.

headline.seo: Kelly Appears on Defensive Over Wide Muslim Monitoring
headline.main: Police Leader’s Evolving Efforts to Defend Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Kelly’s Efforts to Defend Surveillance Evolve
